bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Luis Rudolf Miranda, August 14, 1940

div1.p: Hench inquires if the house at “20 General Lee Street” is the same as in 1900.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Luis Rudolf Miranda, August 14, 1940
div1.opener:
MAYO CLINIC
ROCHESTER, MINNESOTA
August 14, 1940
DR. PHILIP S. HENCH
DR. CHARLES H. SLOCUMB
Senor Luis Rudolf Miranda
Sub-Secretary of State
#20 General Lee Street
Marianao, Havana
Cuba
My dear Senor Miranda:
div1.p:
In April of this year, I spent several days in Havana, doing
some medical historical researches on yellow fever. Dr. Walter Reed, the
American medical army office, who, with his colleagues, confirmed the theory
of Dr. Finlay of Havana, wrote in one of his papers, that yellow fever had
been studied by him in a house at #102 Calzada Real and that the yellow fever
had then jumped around the corner to the house at #20 General Lee Street, and
from thence to another house right across from #20 General Lee Street.

Senor Suarez-Solis who now lives at #102 Real Street told me
that he understood that neither of these houses had had their numbers changed
in all these years since 1900. He understood that you now lived in #20 General
Lee Street. I should be most appreciative if you would tell me whether you
know that the number of your house has been unchanged in all these years. If
you do not know this, could you give me the name of a former owner who might
know this? And whether he remembers anything about yellow-fever victims in
your house in 1900.
I appreciate this help very greatly indeed.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
